name: Goan Pork Vindaloo
history: Goan Pork Vindaloo is a traditional dish from Goa, India, with Portuguese influences. The dish is known for its fiery hot and tangy flavor, originating from the Portuguese dish 'Carne de Vinha d'Alhos'.
description: Goan Pork Vindaloo is a spicy and tangy curry made with pork marinated in vinegar and spices. This dish is characterized by its bold flavors, which include garlic, vinegar, and a blend of aromatic spices.

instructions.title: Marinate the Pork
instructions.description: Marinate the pork cubes with minced garlic, ginger, vinegar, dried red chilies, cumin seeds, mustard seeds, turmeric powder, ground coriander, sugar, and salt. Set aside for at least 2 hours or overnight.

instructions.title: SautÃ© Onions
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add onions and cook until golden.

instructions.title: Cook the Pork
instructions.description: Add the marinated pork to the pan. Cook until the pork is browned on all sides.

instructions.title: Simmer with Tomatoes
instructions.description: Add chopped tomatoes to the pan. Add water to cover the pork. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer until the pork is tender and the sauce has thickened.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with rice or Indian bread.

tips: Allow the pork to marinate for as long as possible for better flavor infusion.
Adjust the amount of dried red chilies according to your spice preference.
variations: Add potatoes or bell peppers for additional texture.
For a less spicy version, reduce the amount of dried red chilies.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional clay pot for an authentic presentation.
Pair with a side of cooling yogurt or raita.
